intro: Adelioides decumbens, commonly known as the creeping adelioides, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its low-growing, sprawling habit with lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
